    93‚Üí## Code Generation
    94‚Üí
    95‚Üí**‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING**: Code generation overwrites ALL generated code in `dipeo/diagram_generated/`!
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí### Workflow
    98‚Üí1. **Modify TypeScript specs** in `/dipeo/models/src/`, then: `cd dipeo/models && pnpm build`
    99‚Üí2. **Generate**: `make codegen` (includes parse-typescript automatically)
   100‚Üí3. **Verify**: `make diff-staged` to review changes
   101‚Üí4. **Apply**: Choose one:
   102‚Üí   - `make apply-syntax-only` - Applies staged ‚Üí active with syntax validation only (fastest, minimal safety)
   103‚Üí   - `make apply` - Applies staged ‚Üí active with full type checking (safer but slower)
   104‚Üí   - `make apply-test` - Applies staged ‚Üí active after full server validation (strongest safety, ensures server can actually run)
   105‚Üí5. **Update GraphQL**: `make graphql-schema`
   106‚Üí
   107‚ÜíQuick command: `make codegen-auto` (runs all steps - USE WITH CAUTION)
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí### Staging System
   110‚Üí- **Generated to**: `dipeo/diagram_generated_staged/` (for review - temporary staging area)
   111‚Üí- **Active code**: `dipeo/diagram_generated/` (in use - DO NOT EDIT DIRECTLY)
   112‚Üí- **Apply changes**: Three validation levels available:
   113‚Üí  - `make apply-syntax-only` - Syntax validation only (fastest)
   114‚Üí  - `make apply` - Full type checking (comprehensive validation)
   115‚Üí  - `make apply-test` - Complete server startup test with staged code (includes critical imports, server health, GraphQL endpoint testing)
   116‚Üí- **Why staging**: Safety, validation, easy rollback
   117‚Üí- **Full docs**: [Code Generation Guide](docs/projects/code-generation-guide.md)
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí## GraphQL Operations System
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí### üéâ Implementation Status: COMPLETE
   122‚ÜíThe GraphQL refactoring is **substantially complete** with a solid, production-ready architecture:
   123‚Üí- ‚úÖ **45 complete operations** with full GraphQL query strings as constants
   124‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Type-safe operation classes** with proper TypedDict for variables
   125‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Well-structured resolvers** following consistent patterns
   126‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Clean 3-tier architecture** separating concerns
   127‚Üí- ‚úÖ **ServiceRegistry integration** for dependency injection
   128‚Üí- ‚úÖ **No major refactoring needed** - architecture is solid and maintainable
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí### Architecture Overview (3-Tier System)
   131‚Üí1. **Generated Layer** (`/dipeo/diagram_generated/graphql/`)
   132‚Üí   - `operations.py` - All 45 operations with full support
   133‚Üí   - `inputs.py`, `results.py`, `domain_types.py`, `enums.py` - Generated types
   134‚Üí
   135‚Üí2. **Application Layer** (`/dipeo/application/graphql/`)
   136‚Üí   - `schema/mutations/` - Organized by entity type
   137‚Üí   - `schema/query_resolvers.py` - Standalone query resolvers
   138‚Üí   - `operation_executor.py` - Central operation mapping
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí3. **Execution Layer** (Infrastructure)
   141‚Üí   - EnhancedServiceRegistry for advanced dependency injection
   142‚Üí   - Event-driven state management
   143‚Üí   - Envelope system for type-safe data flow
   144‚Üí
   145‚Üí### Adding New GraphQL Operations
   146‚Üí1. **Add definition** to `/dipeo/models/src/frontend/query-definitions/[entity].ts`
   147‚Üí2. **Build models**: `cd dipeo/models && pnpm build`
   148‚Üí3. **Generate queries**: `make codegen`
   149‚Üí4. **Apply changes**: `make apply-test`
   150‚Üí5. **Update GraphQL schema**: `make graphql-schema`
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí### Query Definition Structure
   153‚Üí```typescript
   154‚Üí// In /dipeo/models/src/frontend/query-definitions/[entity].ts
   155‚Üíexport const entityQueries: EntityQueryDefinitions = {
   156‚Üí  entity: 'EntityName',
   157‚Üí  queries: [
   158‚Üí    {
   159‚Üí      name: 'GetEntity',
   160‚Üí      type: QueryOperationType.QUERY,
   161‚Üí      variables: [{ name: 'id', type: 'ID', required: true }],
   162‚Üí      fields: [/* GraphQL fields */]
   163‚Üí    }
   164‚Üí  ]
   165‚Üí}
   166‚Üí```
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí### Generated Files & Operations
   169‚Üí- **Frontend Queries**: `/apps/web/src/__generated__/queries/all-queries.ts` - All GraphQL operations
   170‚Üí- **React Hooks**: `/apps/web/src/__generated__/graphql.tsx` - Type-safe hooks for each operation
   171‚Üí- **Python Operations**: `/dipeo/diagram_generated/graphql/operations.py` - Typed Python classes
   172‚Üí- **45 operations** currently defined (23 queries, 21 mutations, 1 subscription)
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí### Usage in Frontend
   175‚Üí```typescript
   176‚Üí// Import generated hooks
   177‚Üíimport { useGetExecutionQuery } from '@/__generated__/graphql';
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üí// Use in components
   180‚Üíconst { data, loading } = useGetExecutionQuery({
   181‚Üí  variables: { id: executionId }
   182‚Üí});
   183‚Üí```
   184‚Üí
   185‚Üí### Usage in Python
   186‚Üí
   187‚Üí```python
   188‚Üí# Import generated operations
   189‚Üífrom dipeo.diagram_generated.graphql_backups.operations import (
   190‚Üí    ExecuteDiagramOperation,
   191‚Üí    GetExecutionOperation,
   192‚Üí    EXECUTE_DIAGRAM_MUTATION
   193‚Üí)
   194‚Üí
   195‚Üí# Use query strings directly
   196‚Üíquery = EXECUTE_DIAGRAM_MUTATION
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí# Or use typed operation classes
   199‚Üívariables = ExecuteDiagramOperation.get_variables_dict(
   200‚Üí    input={"diagram_id": "example", "variables": {}}
   201‚Üí)
   202‚Üí```
   203‚Üí
   204‚Üí### Key Benefits of Current Implementation
   205‚Üí- **Type Safety**: Full type safety from TypeScript to Python
   206‚Üí- **Consistency**: All resolvers follow established patterns
   207‚Üí- **Maintainability**: Clean separation of concerns
   208‚Üí- **Performance**: Optimized with per-execution caching
   209‚Üí- **Developer Experience**: Auto-completion and inline documentation
   210‚Üí
   211‚ÜíFor detailed architecture documentation, see [GraphQL Layer Architecture](docs/architecture/graphql-layer.md)
   212‚Üí
   213‚Üí## Quality Commands
   214‚Üí```bash
   215‚Üímake lint-server        # Lint Python
   216‚Üímake lint-web           # Lint TypeScript
   217‚Üímake format             # Format Python with ruff
   218‚Üípnpm typecheck          # TypeScript type checking
   219‚Üímake graphql-schema     # Update GraphQL types
   220‚Üí```
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí## Architecture Overview
   223‚Üí
   224‚Üí### Key Concepts
   225‚Üí- **Code Generation**: All models/schemas generated from TypeScript specs in `/dipeo/models/src/`
   226‚Üí- **Generated Code**: Lives in `dipeo/diagram_generated/` (DO NOT EDIT DIRECTLY)
   227‚Üí- **Diagrams**: Stored in `/examples/`, `/projects/`, or `/files/`
   228‚Üí- **Service Architecture**: Mixin-based composition (LoggingMixin, ValidationMixin, ConfigurationMixin, CachingMixin, InitializationMixin)
   229‚Üí- **Event System**: Unified EventBus protocol for all event handling
   230‚Üí- **Output Pattern**: Envelope pattern with EnvelopeFactory for all handler outputs
   231‚Üí
   232‚Üí### Key Architecture Documentation
   233‚Üí- **[Overall Architecture](docs/architecture/overall_architecture.md)** - Complete system design
   234‚Üí- **[Memory System](docs/architecture/memory_system_design.md)** - Conversation memory management
   235‚Üí- **[Diagram Execution](docs/architecture/diagram-execution.md)** - Execution flow details
   236‚Üí- **[GraphQL Layer](docs/architecture/graphql-layer.md)** - GraphQL implementation
   237‚Üí
   238‚Üí### Node Handlers - Path Reference
   239‚Üí**Base Directory**: `/dipeo/application/execution/handlers/`
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí#### Individual Node Handlers (Direct Files)

   243‚Üí- `db.py` - Database operations

   270‚Üí### Key Directories
   271‚Üí- `/apps/server/` - FastAPI backend
   272‚Üí- `/apps/web/` - React frontend ([Frontend README](apps/web/src/domain/README.md))
   273‚Üí- `/apps/cli/` - CLI tool ([CLI Documentation](apps/cli/README.md))

   277‚Üí- `/projects/frontend_enhance/` - Advanced frontend generation ([Frontend Enhance](docs/projects/frontend-enhance-guide.md))
   278‚Üí
   279‚Üí### LLM Infrastructure (Updated 2025)
   280‚Üí- **Unified Client Architecture**: All providers use unified clients directly (no adapter/client separation)
   281‚Üí- **OpenAI API v2 Migration**:
   282‚Üí  - Uses new `responses.create()` and `responses.parse()` APIs
   283‚Üí  - `messages` ‚Üí `input` parameter

   287‚Üí- **Domain Adapters**:
   288‚Üí  - `LLMMemorySelectionAdapter`: Intelligent memory filtering and selection
   289‚Üí  - `LLMDecisionAdapter`: Binary decision making for conditions
   290‚Üí- **Provider Support**: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Ollama, Claude Code
   291‚Üí- **Documentation**: [Claude Code Integration](docs/integrations/claude-code.md)
   292‚Üí
   293‚Üí## Enhanced Service Registry
   294‚Üí
   295‚Üí### Overview
   296‚ÜíDiPeO uses an **EnhancedServiceRegistry** for advanced dependency injection with production safety features and comprehensive service management. This replaces the basic ServiceRegistry with enhanced capabilities for enterprise-grade service orchestration.
   297‚Üí
   298‚Üí### Key Features
   299‚Üí
   300‚Üí#### Service Type Categorization
   301‚ÜíAll services are categorized by type for better organization and validation:
   302‚Üí- **CORE**: Essential system services (EVENT_BUS, STATE_STORE)
   303‚Üí- **APPLICATION**: Application-layer services (handlers, executors)
   304‚Üí- **DOMAIN**: Domain logic services (business rules, validators)
   305‚Üí- **ADAPTER**: External integrations (LLM clients, databases)
   306‚Üí- **REPOSITORY**: Data access services (persistence layers)
   307‚Üí
   308‚Üí#### Production Safety
   309‚Üí- **Registry Freezing**: Automatically freezes in production after bootstrap to prevent accidental modifications
   310‚Üí- **Final Services**: Critical services marked as final cannot be overridden (EVENT_BUS)
   311‚Üí- **Immutable Services**: Core services marked as immutable cannot be modified (STATE_STORE)
   312‚Üí- **Environment Detection**: Automatically detects production environment and applies safety constraints
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí#### Audit Trail & Debugging
   315‚Üí- **Registration History**: Complete audit trail of all service registrations with timestamps
   316‚Üí- **Dependency Validation**: Validates service dependencies and detects circular references
   317‚Üí- **Usage Metrics**: Tracks service retrieval patterns for performance optimization
   318‚Üí- **Service Health**: Monitors service lifecycle and availability
   319‚Üí
   320‚Üí### Usage Examples
   321‚Üí
   322‚Üí#### Basic Service Registration
   323‚Üí```python
   324‚Üífrom dipeo.infrastructure.enhanced_service_registry import EnhancedServiceRegistry, ServiceType
   325‚Üí
   326‚Üíregistry = EnhancedServiceRegistry()
   327‚Üí
   328‚Üí# Register with type categorization
   329‚Üíregistry.register("my_service", my_service_instance, ServiceType.APPLICATION)
   330‚Üí
   331‚Üí# Register with special markers
   332‚Üíregistry.register("critical_service", service, ServiceType.CORE, final=True)
   333‚Üíregistry.register("config_service", config, ServiceType.DOMAIN, immutable=True)
   334‚Üí```
   335‚Üí
   336‚Üí#### Audit Trail Access
   337‚Üí```python
   338‚Üí# Get registration history for debugging
   339‚Üíhistory = registry.get_audit_trail()
   340‚Üífor entry in history:
   341‚Üí    print(f"{entry.timestamp}: {entry.action} - {entry.service_name} ({entry.service_type})")
   342‚Üí
   343‚Üí# Get service usage metrics
   344‚Üímetrics = registry.get_service_metrics("EVENT_BUS")
   345‚Üíprint(f"Retrieved {metrics.retrieval_count} times")
   346‚Üí```
   347‚Üí
   348‚Üí#### Service Validation
   349‚Üí```python
   350‚Üí# Validate all dependencies before production deployment
   351‚Üívalidation_result = registry.validate_dependencies()
   352‚Üíif not validation_result.is_valid:
   353‚Üí    for error in validation_result.errors:
   354‚Üí        print(f"Dependency error: {error}")
   355‚Üí
   356‚Üí# Check if registry is properly configured
   357‚Üíif registry.is_frozen:
   358‚Üí    print("Registry is production-ready and frozen")
   359‚Üí```
   360‚Üí
   361‚Üí#### Protected Services
   362‚Üí```python
   363‚Üí# Critical services are automatically protected
   364‚Üíregistry.get("EVENT_BUS")    # Always available, final service
   365‚Üíregistry.get("STATE_STORE")  # Always available, immutable service
   366‚Üí
   367‚Üí# These services cannot be modified in production:
   368‚Üí# - EVENT_BUS (final): Cannot be overridden
   369‚Üí# - STATE_STORE (immutable): Cannot be modified
   370‚Üí```
   371‚Üí
   372‚Üí### Integration with Existing Architecture
   373‚Üí- **Mixin Compatibility**: Works seamlessly with existing service mixins
   374‚Üí- **EventBus Integration**: EVENT_BUS service is automatically protected as final
   375‚Üí- **StateStore Protection**: STATE_STORE marked as immutable for data integrity
   376‚Üí- **GraphQL Layer**: Integrates with GraphQL resolvers for dependency injection
   377‚Üí
   378‚Üí### Best Practices
   379‚Üí1. **Use Type Categories**: Always specify ServiceType when registering services
   380‚Üí2. **Mark Critical Services**: Use `final=True` for services that should never be overridden
   381‚Üí3. **Protect Core State**: Use `immutable=True` for configuration and state services
   382‚Üí4. **Monitor in Development**: Use audit trail to debug service dependency issues
   383‚Üí5. **Validate Before Production**: Always run dependency validation before deployment
   384‚Üí
   385‚Üí### Migration from Basic ServiceRegistry
   386‚ÜíThe migration is automatic - existing code continues to work with enhanced features available:
   387‚Üí```python
   388‚Üí# Old code still works
   389‚Üíregistry.register("service", instance)
   390‚Üíservice = registry.get("service")
   391‚Üí
   392‚Üí# Enhanced features available
   393‚Üíregistry.register("service", instance, ServiceType.APPLICATION, final=True)
   394‚Üíhistory = registry.get_audit_trail()
   395‚Üí```
   396‚Üí
   397‚Üí## Adding New Features
   398‚Üí
   399‚Üí### New Node Types
   400‚Üí1. Create specification in `/dipeo/models/src/node-specs/`
   401‚Üí2. Build models: `cd dipeo/models && pnpm build`
   402‚Üí3. Generate: `make codegen`
   403‚Üí4. Apply: `make apply-test`
   404‚Üí5. Update GraphQL: `make graphql-schema`
   405‚Üí6. See: [Code Generation Guide](docs/projects/code-generation-guide.md)
   406‚Üí
   407‚Üí### Other Changes
   408‚Üí- **API changes**: Modify GraphQL schema, then `make graphql-schema`
   409‚Üí- **UI changes**: Work in `/apps/web/src/`
   410‚Üí- **Documentation**: [GraphQL Layer](docs/architecture/graphql-layer.md)
   411‚Üí
   412‚Üí## Important Notes
   413‚Üí
   414‚Üí- **Python 3.13+** required
   415‚Üí- Use **uv** for Python, **pnpm** for JavaScript (not npm/yarn)
   416‚Üí- Default LLM: `gpt-5-nano-2025-08-07`
   417‚Üí- Backend port: 8000, Frontend port: 3000
   418‚Üí- **v1.0 Refactoring Complete**: Services use mixin composition, unified EventBus, complete Envelope migration
   419‚Üí- **Enhanced Service Registry**: Production-ready dependency injection with type categorization, audit trails, and safety features
   420‚Üí
   421‚Üí## Common Issues & Solutions
   422‚Üí
   423‚Üí| Issue | Solution | Documentation |
   424‚Üí|---|---|---|
   425‚Üí| Import errors | Run `make install` (uv manages activation automatically) | |
   426‚Üí| uv not found | `make install` (auto-installs uv) | |
   427‚Üí| Generated code out of sync | Run codegen workflow (see above) | [Codegen Guide](docs/projects/code-generation-guide.md) |
   428‚Üí| TypeScript errors | `make graphql-schema` | |

   433‚Üí| Claude Code sessions | Use `dipeocc` to convert sessions | [DiPeOCC Guide](docs/projects/dipeocc-guide.md) |
   434‚Üí
   435‚Üí## Testing & Debugging

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with this DiPeO repository.

## Project Overview

DiPeO is a monorepo for building and executing AI-powered agent workflows through visual programming:
- **Frontend** (apps/web/): React-based visual diagram editor
- **Backend** (apps/server/): FastAPI server with GraphQL API
- **CLI** (apps/cli/): Command-line tool for running diagrams (`dipeo` command)

## üìö Documentation Structure

### Core Documentation
- **[Documentation Index](docs/index.md)** - Complete documentation overview
- **[User Guide](docs/README.md)** - Getting started with DiPeO
- **[Motivations](docs/motivations.md)** - Project background and philosophy
- **[CLI Reference](apps/cli/README.md)** - Complete CLI documentation

### Architecture & Design
- **[Overall Architecture](docs/architecture/overall_architecture.md)** - System architecture and tech stack
- **[GraphQL Layer](docs/architecture/graphql-layer.md)** - Complete GraphQL implementation (3-tier)
- **[Memory System Design](docs/architecture/memory_system_design.md)** - Conversation memory architecture
- **[GraphQL Subscriptions](docs/architecture/graphql-subscriptions.md)** - Real-time updates
- **[Diagram Execution](docs/architecture/diagram-execution.md)** - Execution engine details

### Diagram Formats
- **[Diagram Formats Overview](docs/formats/diagram_formats.md)** - Native, Light, Readable formats
- **[Light Diagram Guide](docs/formats/comprehensive_light_diagram_guide.md)** - Complete Light YAML guide ‚≠ê
  - **Essential reading** for working with Light format diagrams
  - Includes syntax, examples, best practices

### Project Guides
- **[Code Generation Guide](docs/projects/code-generation-guide.md)** - Complete codegen pipeline
- **[DiPeOCC Guide](docs/projects/dipeocc-guide.md)** - Claude Code session conversion ‚≠ê
- **[DiPeO AI Generation](docs/projects/dipeodipeo-guide.md)** - Natural language to diagrams
- **[Frontend Auto](projects/frontend_auto/README.md)** - Rapid AI-powered frontend generation
- **[Frontend Enhance](docs/projects/frontend-enhance-guide.md)** - Advanced intelligent memory selection

### Integrations
- **[Claude Code Integration](docs/integrations/claude-code.md)** - Claude Code SDK integration
- **[Webhook Integration](docs/features/webhook-integration.md)** - Webhook support

### Node Types
- **[Diff Patch Node](docs/nodes/diff-patch.md)** - File modification via diffs

## Essential Commands

### Setup & Development
```bash
make install          # Install all dependencies (installs uv if needed)
make dev-all          # Start both frontend and backend
make dev-server       # Start backend only
make dev-web          # Start frontend only
```

### Running Diagrams
```bash
dipeo run examples/simple_diagrams/simple_iter --light --debug --timeout=30
dipeo run [diagram] --input-data '{"key": "value"}' --light --debug
```
- **Light diagrams**: Read [Light Diagram Guide](docs/formats/comprehensive_light_diagram_guide.md)
- Add `--debug` for detailed logs
- Use `simple_iter_cc` diagram to test Claude Code adapter
- Monitor at `http://localhost:3000/?monitor=true`

### Natural Language to Diagram
```bash
dipeo ask --to "create a workflow that fetches weather and sends email" --and-run
```
- See [DiPeO AI Generation Guide](docs/projects/dipeodipeo-guide.md)

### Converting Claude Code Sessions
```bash
dipeocc list                    # List recent Claude Code sessions
dipeocc convert --latest        # Convert latest session to diagram
dipeocc convert session-id      # Convert specific session
dipeocc watch --auto-execute    # Watch and auto-execute new sessions
dipeocc stats session-id        # Show session statistics
```
- **Session location**: `~/.claude/projects/-home-soryhyun-DiPeO/`
- **Output**: `projects/claude_code/sessions/{session_id}/`
- **Full guide**: [DiPeOCC Guide](docs/projects/dipeocc-guide.md)

### Integrations & API Management
```bash
dipeo integrations init               # Initialize integrations workspace
dipeo integrations validate            # Validate provider manifests
dipeo integrations openapi-import spec.yaml --name my-api
dipeo integrations claude-code --sync-mode auto --watch-todos
```

## Code Generation

**‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING**: Code generation overwrites ALL generated code in `dipeo/diagram_generated/`!

### Workflow
1. **Modify TypeScript specs** in `/dipeo/models/src/`, then: `cd dipeo/models && pnpm build`
2. **Generate**: `make codegen` (includes parse-typescript automatically)
3. **Verify**: `make diff-staged` to review changes
4. **Apply**: Choose one:
   - `make apply-syntax-only` - Applies staged ‚Üí active with syntax validation only (fastest, minimal safety)
   - `make apply` - Applies staged ‚Üí active with full type checking (safer but slower)
   - `make apply-test` - Applies staged ‚Üí active after full server validation (strongest safety, ensures server can actually run)
5. **Update GraphQL**: `make graphql-schema`

Quick command: `make codegen-auto` (runs all steps - USE WITH CAUTION)

### Staging System
- **Generated to**: `dipeo/diagram_generated_staged/` (for review - temporary staging area)
- **Active code**: `dipeo/diagram_generated/` (in use - DO NOT EDIT DIRECTLY)
- **Apply changes**: Three validation levels available:
  - `make apply-syntax-only` - Syntax validation only (fastest)
  - `make apply` - Full type checking (comprehensive validation)
  - `make apply-test` - Complete server startup test with staged code (includes critical imports, server health, GraphQL endpoint testing)
- **Why staging**: Safety, validation, easy rollback
- **Full docs**: [Code Generation Guide](docs/projects/code-generation-guide.md)

## GraphQL Operations System

### üéâ Implementation Status: COMPLETE
The GraphQL refactoring is **substantially complete** with a solid, production-ready architecture:
- ‚úÖ **45 complete operations** with full GraphQL query strings as constants
- ‚úÖ **Type-safe operation classes** with proper TypedDict for variables
- ‚úÖ **Well-structured resolvers** following consistent patterns
- ‚úÖ **Clean 3-tier architecture** separating concerns
- ‚úÖ **ServiceRegistry integration** for dependency injection
- ‚úÖ **No major refactoring needed** - architecture is solid and maintainable

### Architecture Overview (3-Tier System)
1. **Generated Layer** (`/dipeo/diagram_generated/graphql/`)
   - `operations.py` - All 45 operations with full support
   - `inputs.py`, `results.py`, `domain_types.py`, `enums.py` - Generated types

2. **Application Layer** (`/dipeo/application/graphql/`)
   - `schema/mutations/` - Organized by entity type
   - `schema/query_resolvers.py` - Standalone query resolvers
   - `operation_executor.py` - Central operation mapping

3. **Execution Layer** (Infrastructure)
   - EnhancedServiceRegistry for advanced dependency injection
   - Event-driven state management
   - Envelope system for type-safe data flow

### Adding New GraphQL Operations
1. **Add definition** to `/dipeo/models/src/frontend/query-definitions/[entity].ts`
2. **Build models**: `cd dipeo/models && pnpm build`
3. **Generate queries**: `make codegen`
4. **Apply changes**: `make apply-test`
5. **Update GraphQL schema**: `make graphql-schema`

### Query Definition Structure
```typescript
// In /dipeo/models/src/frontend/query-definitions/[entity].ts
export const entityQueries: EntityQueryDefinitions = {
  entity: 'EntityName',
  queries: [
    {
      name: 'GetEntity',
      type: QueryOperationType.QUERY,
      variables: [{ name: 'id', type: 'ID', required: true }],
      fields: [/* GraphQL fields */]
    }
  ]
}
```

### Generated Files & Operations
- **Frontend Queries**: `/apps/web/src/__generated__/queries/all-queries.ts` - All GraphQL operations
- **React Hooks**: `/apps/web/src/__generated__/graphql.tsx` - Type-safe hooks for each operation
- **Python Operations**: `/dipeo/diagram_generated/graphql/operations.py` - Typed Python classes
- **45 operations** currently defined (23 queries, 21 mutations, 1 subscription)

### Usage in Frontend
```typescript
// Import generated hooks
import { useGetExecutionQuery } from '@/__generated__/graphql';

// Use in components
const { data, loading } = useGetExecutionQuery({
  variables: { id: executionId }
});
```

### Usage in Python

```python
# Import generated operations
from dipeo.diagram_generated.graphql_backups.operations import (
    ExecuteDiagramOperation,
    GetExecutionOperation,
    EXECUTE_DIAGRAM_MUTATION
)

# Use query strings directly
query = EXECUTE_DIAGRAM_MUTATION

# Or use typed operation classes
variables = ExecuteDiagramOperation.get_variables_dict(
    input={"diagram_id": "example", "variables": {}}
)
```

### Key Benefits of Current Implementation
- **Type Safety**: Full type safety from TypeScript to Python
- **Consistency**: All resolvers follow established patterns
- **Maintainability**: Clean separation of concerns
- **Performance**: Optimized with per-execution caching
- **Developer Experience**: Auto-completion and inline documentation

For detailed architecture documentation, see [GraphQL Layer Architecture](docs/architecture/graphql-layer.md)

## Quality Commands
```bash
make lint-server        # Lint Python
make lint-web           # Lint TypeScript
make format             # Format Python with ruff
pnpm typecheck          # TypeScript type checking
make graphql-schema     # Update GraphQL types
```

## Architecture Overview

### Key Concepts
- **Code Generation**: All models/schemas generated from TypeScript specs in `/dipeo/models/src/`
- **Generated Code**: Lives in `dipeo/diagram_generated/` (DO NOT EDIT DIRECTLY)
- **Diagrams**: Stored in `/examples/`, `/projects/`, or `/files/`
- **Service Architecture**: Mixin-based composition (LoggingMixin, ValidationMixin, ConfigurationMixin, CachingMixin, InitializationMixin)
- **Event System**: Unified EventBus protocol for all event handling
- **Output Pattern**: Envelope pattern with EnvelopeFactory for all handler outputs

### Key Architecture Documentation
- **[Overall Architecture](docs/architecture/overall_architecture.md)** - Complete system design
- **[Memory System](docs/architecture/memory_system_design.md)** - Conversation memory management
- **[Diagram Execution](docs/architecture/diagram-execution.md)** - Execution flow details
- **[GraphQL Layer](docs/architecture/graphql-layer.md)** - GraphQL implementation

### Node Handlers - Path Reference
**Base Directory**: `/dipeo/application/execution/handlers/`

#### Individual Node Handlers (Direct Files)
- `api_job.py` - API call handling
- `db.py` - Database operations
- `endpoint.py` - HTTP endpoint handling
- `hook.py` - Hook/callback handling
- `integrated_api.py` - Integrated API operations ([Integration Guide](docs/integrations/claude-code.md))
- `json_schema_validator.py` - JSON schema validation
- `start.py` - Start node handling
- `template_job.py` - Template processing
- `typescript_ast.py` - TypeScript AST operations
- `user_response.py` - User response handling

#### Complex Node Handlers (Subdirectories)
- **person_job/** - LLM/AI agent handling
  - `batch_executor.py` - Batch person execution
  - `conversation_handler.py` - Conversation management
  - `prompt_resolver.py` - Prompt resolution
  - `text_format_handler.py` - Text formatting
- **sub_diagram/** - Sub-diagram execution
  - `lightweight_executor.py` - Light diagram execution
  - `single_executor.py` - Single sub-diagram execution
  - `batch_executor.py` - Batch sub-diagram execution
  - `parallel_executor.py` - Parallel execution
  - `base_executor.py` - Base executor logic
- **code_job/** - Code execution
  - `executors/` - Various code executors
- **condition/** - Conditional logic
  - `evaluators/` - Condition evaluators

### Key Directories
- `/apps/server/` - FastAPI backend
- `/apps/web/` - React frontend ([Frontend README](apps/web/src/domain/README.md))
- `/apps/cli/` - CLI tool ([CLI Documentation](apps/cli/README.md))
- `/dipeo/` - Backend business logic (application/domain/infrastructure layers)
- `/projects/codegen/` - Code generation system ([Codegen Guide](docs/projects/code-generation-guide.md))
- `/projects/frontend_auto/` - AI frontend generation ([Frontend Auto](projects/frontend_auto/README.md))
- `/projects/frontend_enhance/` - Advanced frontend generation ([Frontend Enhance](docs/projects/frontend-enhance-guide.md))

### LLM Infrastructure (Updated 2025)
- **Unified Client Architecture**: All providers use unified clients directly (no adapter/client separation)
- **OpenAI API v2 Migration**:
  - Uses new `responses.create()` and `responses.parse()` APIs
  - `messages` ‚Üí `input` parameter
  - `max_tokens` ‚Üí `max_output_tokens`
  - Temperature parameter no longer supported
  - Response structure: `response.output[0].content[0].text`
- **Domain Adapters**:
  - `LLMMemorySelectionAdapter`: Intelligent memory filtering and selection
  - `LLMDecisionAdapter`: Binary decision making for conditions
- **Provider Support**: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Ollama, Claude Code
- **Documentation**: [Claude Code Integration](docs/integrations/claude-code.md)

## Enhanced Service Registry

### Overview
DiPeO uses an **EnhancedServiceRegistry** for advanced dependency injection with production safety features and comprehensive service management. This replaces the basic ServiceRegistry with enhanced capabilities for enterprise-grade service orchestration.

### Key Features

#### Service Type Categorization
All services are categorized by type for better organization and validation:
- **CORE**: Essential system services (EVENT_BUS, STATE_STORE)
- **APPLICATION**: Application-layer services (handlers, executors)
- **DOMAIN**: Domain logic services (business rules, validators)
- **ADAPTER**: External integrations (LLM clients, databases)
- **REPOSITORY**: Data access services (persistence layers)

#### Production Safety
- **Registry Freezing**: Automatically freezes in production after bootstrap to prevent accidental modifications
- **Final Services**: Critical services marked as final cannot be overridden (EVENT_BUS)
- **Immutable Services**: Core services marked as immutable cannot be modified (STATE_STORE)
- **Environment Detection**: Automatically detects production environment and applies safety constraints

#### Audit Trail & Debugging
- **Registration History**: Complete audit trail of all service registrations with timestamps
- **Dependency Validation**: Validates service dependencies and detects circular references
- **Usage Metrics**: Tracks service retrieval patterns for performance optimization
- **Service Health**: Monitors service lifecycle and availability

### Usage Examples

#### Basic Service Registration
```python
from dipeo.infrastructure.enhanced_service_registry import EnhancedServiceRegistry, ServiceType

registry = EnhancedServiceRegistry()

# Register with type categorization
registry.register("my_service", my_service_instance, ServiceType.APPLICATION)

# Register with special markers
registry.register("critical_service", service, ServiceType.CORE, final=True)
registry.register("config_service", config, ServiceType.DOMAIN, immutable=True)
```

#### Audit Trail Access
```python
# Get registration history for debugging
history = registry.get_audit_trail()
for entry in history:
    print(f"{entry.timestamp}: {entry.action} - {entry.service_name} ({entry.service_type})")

# Get service usage metrics
metrics = registry.get_service_metrics("EVENT_BUS")
print(f"Retrieved {metrics.retrieval_count} times")
```

#### Service Validation
```python
# Validate all dependencies before production deployment
validation_result = registry.validate_dependencies()
if not validation_result.is_valid:
    for error in validation_result.errors:
        print(f"Dependency error: {error}")

# Check if registry is properly configured
if registry.is_frozen:
    print("Registry is production-ready and frozen")
```

#### Protected Services
```python
# Critical services are automatically protected
registry.get("EVENT_BUS")    # Always available, final service
registry.get("STATE_STORE")  # Always available, immutable service

# These services cannot be modified in production:
# - EVENT_BUS (final): Cannot be overridden
# - STATE_STORE (immutable): Cannot be modified
```

### Integration with Existing Architecture
- **Mixin Compatibility**: Works seamlessly with existing service mixins
- **EventBus Integration**: EVENT_BUS service is automatically protected as final
- **StateStore Protection**: STATE_STORE marked as immutable for data integrity
- **GraphQL Layer**: Integrates with GraphQL resolvers for dependency injection

### Best Practices
1. **Use Type Categories**: Always specify ServiceType when registering services
2. **Mark Critical Services**: Use `final=True` for services that should never be overridden
3. **Protect Core State**: Use `immutable=True` for configuration and state services
4. **Monitor in Development**: Use audit trail to debug service dependency issues
5. **Validate Before Production**: Always run dependency validation before deployment

### Migration from Basic ServiceRegistry
The migration is automatic - existing code continues to work with enhanced features available:
```python
# Old code still works
registry.register("service", instance)
service = registry.get("service")

# Enhanced features available
registry.register("service", instance, ServiceType.APPLICATION, final=True)
history = registry.get_audit_trail()
```

## Adding New Features

### New Node Types
1. Create specification in `/dipeo/models/src/node-specs/`
2. Build models: `cd dipeo/models && pnpm build`
3. Generate: `make codegen`
4. Apply: `make apply-test`
5. Update GraphQL: `make graphql-schema`
6. See: [Code Generation Guide](docs/projects/code-generation-guide.md)

### Other Changes
- **API changes**: Modify GraphQL schema, then `make graphql-schema`
- **UI changes**: Work in `/apps/web/src/`
- **Documentation**: [GraphQL Layer](docs/architecture/graphql-layer.md)

## Important Notes

- **Python 3.13+** required
- Use **uv** for Python, **pnpm** for JavaScript (not npm/yarn)
- Default LLM: `gpt-5-nano-2025-08-07`
- Backend port: 8000, Frontend port: 3000
- **v1.0 Refactoring Complete**: Services use mixin composition, unified EventBus, complete Envelope migration
- **Enhanced Service Registry**: Production-ready dependency injection with type categorization, audit trails, and safety features

## Common Issues & Solutions

| Issue | Solution | Documentation |
|---|---|---|
| Import errors | Run `make install` (uv manages activation automatically) | |
| uv not found | `make install` (auto-installs uv) | |
| Generated code out of sync | Run codegen workflow (see above) | [Codegen Guide](docs/projects/code-generation-guide.md) |
| TypeScript errors | `make graphql-schema` | |
| Need debugging | Add `--debug` flag, check `.logs/` | |
| OpenAI temperature error | Temperature not supported in new API, remove parameter | |
| OpenAI max_tokens error | Use `max_output_tokens` instead of `max_tokens` | |
| TokenUsage missing 'total' | Use `total_tokens` property instead | |
| Claude Code sessions | Use `dipeocc` to convert sessions | [DiPeOCC Guide](docs/projects/dipeocc-guide.md) |

## Testing & Debugging

- **Debug diagrams**: `dipeo run [diagram] --debug`
- **Monitor UI**: `http://localhost:3000/?monitor=true`
- **GraphQL playground**: `http://localhost:8000/graphql`
- **Logs**: Check `.logs/server.log` for detailed debugging
- **Note**: Formal test suite is under development

1‚Üí# DiPeO Server
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíThe backend API server for DiPeO, providing GraphQL and REST endpoints for diagram execution and management.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## Architecture
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí```
     8‚Üíapps/server/
     9‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/dipeo_server/
    10‚Üí‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ api/           # FastAPI/GraphQL adapters
    11‚Üí‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ infra/         # Infrastructure (state storage, caching)
    12‚Üí‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ app_context.py # Container configuration
    13‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main.py            # Server entry point
    14‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main_bundled.py    # PyInstaller entry point
    15‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ schema.graphql     # GraphQL schema
    16‚Üí```
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí## Key Components
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí### API Layer (`api/`)
    21‚Üí- **GraphQL Router**: Strawberry-based GraphQL with subscriptions
    22‚Üí- **SSE Endpoints**: Direct streaming for real-time execution updates
    23‚Üí- **Context Management**: Request-scoped dependency injection
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí### Infrastructure (`infra/`)
    26‚Üí- **StateRegistry**: SQLite-based execution state persistence
    27‚Üí- **ExecutionCache**: In-memory cache for active executions
    28‚Üí- **MessageStore**: Conversation history storage
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí### Container System
    31‚ÜíUses simplified 3-container architecture:
    32‚Üí- **CoreContainer**: Domain services (validators, utilities)
    33‚Üí- **InfrastructureContainer**: External adapters (storage, LLM)
    34‚Üí- **ApplicationContainer**: Use cases and orchestration
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí## Running the Server
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí```bash
    39‚Üí# Development
    40‚Üímake dev-server              # Runs on port 8000
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí# Production (multi-worker)
    43‚ÜíWORKERS=4 python main.py     # Hypercorn with 4 workers
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí# Bundled executable
    46‚Üímake build-server           # Creates standalone executable
    47‚Üí./dist/dipeo-server         # Run bundled server
    48‚Üí```
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí## GraphQL Endpoints
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí- **Playground**: http://localhost:8000/graphql
    53‚Üí- **Queries**: Diagrams, executions, persons, API keys
    54‚Üí- **Mutations**: CRUD operations, diagram execution
    55‚Üí- **Subscriptions**: Real-time execution updates
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí## Environment Variables
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí- `PORT`: Server port (default: 8000)
    60‚Üí- `WORKERS`: Number of worker processes (default: 4)
    61‚Üí- `REDIS_URL`: Redis for multi-worker subscriptions (optional)
    62‚Üí- `STATE_STORE_PATH`: SQLite database path
    63‚Üí- `LOG_LEVEL`: Logging verbosity (INFO/DEBUG)
    64‚Üí

# DiPeO Server

The backend API server for DiPeO, providing GraphQL and REST endpoints for diagram execution and management.

## Architecture

```
apps/server/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/dipeo_server/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ api/           # FastAPI/GraphQL adapters
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ infra/         # Infrastructure (state storage, caching)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ app_context.py # Container configuration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main.py            # Server entry point
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main_bundled.py    # PyInstaller entry point
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ schema.graphql     # GraphQL schema
```

## Key Components

### API Layer (`api/`)
- **GraphQL Router**: Strawberry-based GraphQL with subscriptions
- **SSE Endpoints**: Direct streaming for real-time execution updates
- **Context Management**: Request-scoped dependency injection

### Infrastructure (`infra/`)
- **StateRegistry**: SQLite-based execution state persistence
- **ExecutionCache**: In-memory cache for active executions
- **MessageStore**: Conversation history storage

### Container System
Uses simplified 3-container architecture:
- **CoreContainer**: Domain services (validators, utilities)
- **InfrastructureContainer**: External adapters (storage, LLM)
- **ApplicationContainer**: Use cases and orchestration

## Running the Server

```bash
# Development
make dev-server              # Runs on port 8000

# Production (multi-worker)
WORKERS=4 python main.py     # Hypercorn with 4 workers

# Bundled executable
make build-server           # Creates standalone executable
./dist/dipeo-server         # Run bundled server
```

## GraphQL Endpoints

- **Playground**: http://localhost:8000/graphql
- **Queries**: Diagrams, executions, persons, API keys
- **Mutations**: CRUD operations, diagram execution
- **Subscriptions**: Real-time execution updates

## Environment Variables

- `PORT`: Server port (default: 8000)
- `WORKERS`: Number of worker processes (default: 4)
- `REDIS_URL`: Redis for multi-worker subscriptions (optional)
- `STATE_STORE_PATH`: SQLite database path
- `LOG_LEVEL`: Logging verbosity (INFO/DEBUG)

## SSE Streaming

Direct streaming endpoint for browser clients:
```
GET /sse/executions/{execution_id}
```

Provides real-time execution updates without WebSocket complexity.

# Web Frontend

React-based visual diagram editor for DiPeO.

## Tech Stack
- React 19 + TypeScript + Vite
- XYFlow (diagram editing)
- Apollo Client (GraphQL)
- Zustand (state management)
- TailwindCSS + React Hook Form + Zod

## Commands
```bash
pnpm dev                # Start dev server (localhost:3000)
pnpm build              # Production build
pnpm typecheck          # TypeScript checking
pnpm codegen            # Generate GraphQL types
pnpm lint:fix           # Auto-fix linting
```

## Architecture
```
/apps/web/src/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ __generated__/      # Generated GraphQL types (DO NOT EDIT)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ domain/             # Business logic by domain
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ diagram/        # Diagram editing, properties, personas
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ execution/      # Execution monitoring, conversations
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ infrastructure/     # Technical services
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ store/          # Zustand state management
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ hooks/          # Cross-cutting hooks
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ lib/graphql/        # GraphQL client
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ui/                 # Presentation layer
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ components/     # UI components
```

### Key Imports
```typescript
// Domain hooks & services
import { useDiagramManager } from '@/domain/diagram';
import { useExecution } from '@/domain/execution';
import { useStore } from '@/infrastructure/store';

// Generated GraphQL
import { useGetDiagramQuery } from '@/__generated__/graphql';
```

## Key Concepts

### State Management (Zustand)
- Flattened store with slices: `diagram`, `execution`, `person`, `ui`
- Access via hooks: `useStore()`
- Factory patterns for CRUD operations

### GraphQL
- Queries in `/lib/graphql/queries/`
- Generated hooks in `/__generated__/`
- Real-time subscriptions for updates

### Node System
- Configs generated from TypeScript specs
- Components in `/ui/components/diagram/nodes/`
- Base classes: `BaseNode`, `ConfigurableNode`

### Forms
- React Hook Form + Zod validation
- Auto-save with debouncing
- Dynamic field rendering

## Development Patterns

### Components
```typescript
// Named exports via index.ts
export { MyComponent } from './MyComponent';

// Composition over inheritance
const EnhancedNode = withRightClickDrag(BaseNode);
```

### State & GraphQL
```typescript
// Zustand updates
set((state) => { state.nodes[nodeId] = data; });

// GraphQL hooks
const { data, loading } = useGetDiagramQuery({ 
  variables: { id },
  skip: !id 
});
```

### Styling
- TailwindCSS utilities
- Dark mode via CSS variables


## Infrastructure Services

| Service | Purpose | Location |
|---------|---------|----------|
| ConversionService | Type conversions, GraphQL transforms | `/infrastructure/converters/` |
| NodeService | Node specs, field configs | `/infrastructure/services/` |
| ValidationService | Zod validation, error messages | `/infrastructure/services/` |


## Common Patterns

```typescript
// Custom hooks
function useDiagramManager() {
  const store = useStore();
  return { diagram: store.diagram, save: () => {} };
}

// Factory functions
const createNodeConfig = (spec: NodeSpec): NodeConfig => ({ 
  type: spec.type, 
  fields: generateFields(spec) 
});

// Error boundaries
<ErrorBoundary fallback={<ErrorFallback />}>
  <DiagramEditor />
</ErrorBoundary>
```

## Important Notes

- **Never edit generated files** - Modify TypeScript specs and run codegen
- **Use pnpm** for package management
- **Maintain type safety** - avoid `any` types
- **Extract complex logic** to hooks

## URL Parameters

- `?diagram={format}/{filename}` - Load diagram
- `?monitor=true` - Monitor mode
- `?debug=true` - Debug mode

1‚Üí# Application Layer
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíOrchestrates business logic between domain and infrastructure layers.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## Architecture
     6‚Üí- **3-container DI**: Application ‚Üí Infrastructure ‚Üí Core
     7‚Üí- **Event-driven**: Asynchronous communication via unified EventBus
     8‚Üí- **Type-safe**: ServiceRegistry with compile-time guarantees
     9‚Üí- **Mixin-based Services**: Optional composition with LoggingMixin, ValidationMixin, ConfigurationMixin, CachingMixin, InitializationMixin
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí## Directory Structure
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí### Bootstrap (`bootstrap/`)
    14‚Üí- **application_container.py**: Main application container orchestration
    15‚Üí- **infrastructure_container.py**: Infrastructure service initialization
    16‚Üí- **containers.py**: Core container management and lifecycle
    17‚Üí- **service_registry.py**: Type-safe service locator implementation
    18‚Üí- **wiring.py**: Dependency injection wiring configuration
    19‚Üí- **lifecycle.py**: Component lifecycle protocols
    20‚Üí- **port_metrics.py**: Performance metrics tracking
    21‚Üí
    22‚Üí### Execution Engine (`execution/`)
    23‚Üí- **engine.py**: TypedExecutionEngine - event-driven node execution
    24‚Üí- **orchestrators/**: Central coordination for execution concerns
    25‚Üí  - Person management with unified caching
    26‚Üí  - Prompt loading delegation
    27‚Üí  - Memory selection via LLMMemorySelector
    28‚Üí  - LLM decision execution
    29‚Üí- **handlers/**: Node-specific execution handlers
    30‚Üí  - Simple handlers: Single file (e.g., `start.py`, `api_job.py`, `db.py`)
    31‚Üí  - Complex handlers: Package structure (e.g., `person_job/`, `code_job/`, `sub_diagram/`)
    32‚Üí- **states/**: Execution state management
    33‚Üí- **observers/**: Event observation and monitoring
    34‚Üí- **use_cases/**: Business logic use cases
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí### GraphQL API (`graphql/`)
    37‚Üí- **schema/**: GraphQL schema definitions
    38‚Üí  - queries.py: Query resolvers
    39‚Üí  - mutations/: Mutation implementations
    40‚Üí  - subscriptions.py: Real-time subscriptions
    41‚Üí- **resolvers/**: Business logic resolvers
    42‚Üí- **types/**: GraphQL type definitions
    43‚Üí- **schema_factory.py**: Schema assembly
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí### Conversation Management (`conversation/`)
    46‚Üí- **wiring.py**: Conversation context dependency injection
    47‚Üí- **use_cases/manage_conversation.py**: Conversation lifecycle management
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí### Diagram Operations (`diagram/`)
    50‚Üí- **wiring.py**: Diagram service dependency injection
    51‚Üí- **use_cases/**: Diagram-specific operations
    52‚Üí  - compile_diagram.py: Diagram compilation logic
    53‚Üí  - load_diagram.py: Loading from various sources
    54‚Üí  - serialize_diagram.py: Format conversion
    55‚Üí  - validate_diagram.py: Structure validation
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí### Registry (`registry/`)
    58‚Üí- **service_registry.py**: Type-safe service locator
    59‚Üí- **keys.py**: Service key definitions
    60‚Üí
    61‚Üí### Utilities (`utils/`)
    62‚Üí- **prompt_builder.py**: Dynamic prompt construction
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí## Service Registry
    65‚Üí```python
    66‚Üí# Type-safe service registration
    67‚ÜíLLM_SERVICE = ServiceKey["LLMServicePort"]("llm_service")
    68‚Üíregistry.register(LLM_SERVICE, llm_service_instance)
    69‚Üíllm_service = registry.resolve(LLM_SERVICE)  # Type-safe
    70‚Üí```
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí## Event Architecture
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí- **AsyncEventBus**: Fire-and-forget event distribution
    75‚Üí- **CacheFirstStateStore**: Cache-first persistence with Phase 4 optimizations
    76‚Üí- **Benefits**: No global locks, true parallel execution, clean separation
    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí## Execution Flow
    79‚Üí1. Compile diagram (uses CompileTimeResolver for connections)
    80‚Üí2. Auto-register handlers
    81‚Üí3. Initialize event bus
    82‚Üí4. Execute loop:
    83‚Üí   - Calculate ready nodes (DomainDynamicOrderCalculator)
    84‚Üí   - Resolve inputs (domain.execution.resolution.api.resolve_inputs)
    85‚Üí   - Execute handlers
    86‚Üí   - Emit events (async persistence)
    87‚Üí5. Handle errors via events
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí## Node Handlers
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí```python
    92‚Üí@register_handler
    93‚Üíclass PersonJobNodeHandler(TypedNodeHandler[PersonJobNode]):
    94‚Üí    async def execute_request(self, request: ExecutionRequest) -> Envelope:
    95‚Üí        # Use orchestrator for person management
    96‚Üí        person = await self.orchestrator.get_or_create_person(person_id)
    97‚Üí        
    98‚Üí        # Return output using EnvelopeFactory
    99‚Üí        return EnvelopeFactory.create(
   100‚Üí            body=result_data,
   101‚Üí            produced_by=str(node.id),
   102‚Üí            trace_id=request.execution_id
   103‚Üí        )
   104‚Üí```
   105‚Üí
   106‚Üí- Auto-discovered via `@register_handler` decorator
   107‚Üí- Receive: node instance, context, inputs, services
   108‚Üí- Return Envelope objects using EnvelopeFactory
   109‚Üí- Support single-file or package structure
   110‚Üí- Use ExecutionOrchestrator for person/memory/prompt management
   111‚Üí
   112‚Üí### Output Handling
   113‚Üí
   114‚ÜíAll handlers use the **Envelope pattern**:
   115‚Üí
   116‚Üí```python
   117‚Üí# Text output
   118‚ÜíEnvelopeFactory.create(content, produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)
   119‚Üí
   120‚Üí# JSON/object output  
   121‚ÜíEnvelopeFactory.create(data, produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí# Binary output
   124‚ÜíEnvelopeFactory.create(bytes_data, produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üí# Error output
   127‚ÜíEnvelopeFactory.create(msg, error="Error", produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí# With multiple representations
   130‚Üíenvelope = EnvelopeFactory.create(data, produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)
   131‚Üíenvelope = envelope.with_representations({
   132‚Üí    "text": str(data),
   133‚Üí    "object": data,
   134‚Üí    "markdown": format_as_markdown(data)
   135‚Üí})
   136‚Üí```
   137‚Üí
   138‚ÜíBenefits:
   139‚Üí- **Type safety**: Content-type aware transformations
   140‚Üí- **Multiple representations**: Same data in different formats
   141‚Üí- **Clean API**: Consistent interface across all handlers
   142‚Üí- **Traceability**: Built-in trace_id and produced_by metadata
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí## Design Principles
   145‚Üí1. **Separation of Concerns**: Domain (logic) ‚Üê‚Üí Application (orchestration) ‚Üê‚Üí Infrastructure (I/O)
   146‚Üí2. **Dependency Injection**: Via ServiceRegistry
   147‚Üí3. **Type Safety**: Compile-time guarantees
   148‚Üí4. **Event-Driven**: Async, decoupled communication
   149‚Üí5. **Extensibility**: Add handlers for new node types
   150‚Üí6. **Single Source of Truth**: ExecutionOrchestrator for execution-time concerns
   151‚Üí7. **Context-First**: Access execution context directly (e.g., `context.diagram`)
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí## Integration Points
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí**Domain Layer**:
   157‚Üí- `dipeo.domain.diagram.compilation` - Compile-time resolution
   158‚Üí- `dipeo.domain.execution.resolution` - Runtime input resolution
   159‚Üí- `dipeo.domain.events` - Event contracts
   160‚Üí- `dipeo.domain.ports.storage` - Storage interfaces
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí**Infrastructure Layer**:
   163‚Üí- AsyncEventBus, CacheFirstStateStore, MessageRouter
   164‚Üí
   165‚Üí**Server Layer**:
   166‚Üí- GraphQL/REST adapters, event bus initialization
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí## Key Imports
   169‚Üí
   170‚Üí```python
   171‚Üífrom dipeo.domain.execution.resolution import RuntimeInputResolver, TransformationEngine
   172‚Üífrom dipeo.domain.execution.envelope import EnvelopeFactory
   173‚Üífrom dipeo.domain.diagram.compilation import CompileTimeResolver, Connection
   174‚Üífrom dipeo.domain.events import EventType, ExecutionEvent
   175‚Üífrom dipeo.domain.ports.storage import FileSystemPort
   176‚Üífrom dipeo.domain.integrations.api_services import APIBusinessLogic
   177‚Üífrom dipeo.application.execution.orchestrators import ExecutionOrchestrator
   178‚Üífrom dipeo.application.execution.use_cases import PromptLoadingUseCase
   179‚Üí```
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí## Diagram Access Patterns
   182‚Üí
   183‚Üí### ‚úÖ DO: Use diagram query methods
   184‚ÜíAlways use ExecutableDiagram's built-in query methods for accessing diagram data:
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí```python
   187‚Üí# Get a specific node
   188‚Üínode = context.diagram.get_node(node_id)
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí# Get nodes by type
   191‚Üíperson_job_nodes = context.diagram.get_nodes_by_type(NodeType.PERSON_JOB)
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí# Get incoming edges for a node
   194‚Üíincoming = context.diagram.get_incoming_edges(node_id)
   195‚Üí
   196‚Üí# Get outgoing edges for a node
   197‚Üíoutgoing = context.diagram.get_outgoing_edges(node_id)
   198‚Üí
   199‚Üí# Get start nodes
   200‚Üístart_nodes = context.diagram.get_start_nodes()
   201‚Üí```
   202‚Üí
   203‚Üí### ‚ùå DON'T: Direct access to internals
   204‚ÜíNever directly access diagram internal collections:
   205‚Üí
   206‚Üí```python
   207‚Üí# BAD: Direct access to nodes
   208‚Üífor node in diagram.nodes:  # ‚ùå Don't do this
   209‚Üí    if node.type == NodeType.PERSON_JOB:
   210‚Üí        ...
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí# GOOD: Use query method

# Application Layer

Orchestrates business logic between domain and infrastructure layers.

## Architecture
- **3-container DI**: Application ‚Üí Infrastructure ‚Üí Core
- **Event-driven**: Asynchronous communication via unified EventBus
- **Type-safe**: ServiceRegistry with compile-time guarantees
- **Mixin-based Services**: Optional composition with LoggingMixin, ValidationMixin, ConfigurationMixin, CachingMixin, InitializationMixin

## Directory Structure

### Bootstrap (`bootstrap/`)
- **application_container.py**: Main application container orchestration
- **infrastructure_container.py**: Infrastructure service initialization
- **containers.py**: Core container management and lifecycle
- **service_registry.py**: Type-safe service locator implementation
- **wiring.py**: Dependency injection wiring configuration
- **lifecycle.py**: Component lifecycle protocols
- **port_metrics.py**: Performance metrics tracking

### Execution Engine (`execution/`)
- **engine.py**: TypedExecutionEngine - event-driven node execution
- **orchestrators/**: Central coordination for execution concerns
  - Person management with unified caching
  - Prompt loading delegation
  - Memory selection via LLMMemorySelector
  - LLM decision execution
- **handlers/**: Node-specific execution handlers
  - Simple handlers: Single file (e.g., `start.py`, `api_job.py`, `db.py`)
  - Complex handlers: Package structure (e.g., `person_job/`, `code_job/`, `sub_diagram/`)
- **states/**: Execution state management
- **observers/**: Event observation and monitoring
- **use_cases/**: Business logic use cases

### GraphQL API (`graphql/`)
- **schema/**: GraphQL schema definitions
  - queries.py: Query resolvers
  - mutations/: Mutation implementations
  - subscriptions.py: Real-time subscriptions
- **resolvers/**: Business logic resolvers
- **types/**: GraphQL type definitions
- **schema_factory.py**: Schema assembly

### Conversation Management (`conversation/`)
- **wiring.py**: Conversation context dependency injection
- **use_cases/manage_conversation.py**: Conversation lifecycle management

### Diagram Operations (`diagram/`)
- **wiring.py**: Diagram service dependency injection
- **use_cases/**: Diagram-specific operations
  - compile_diagram.py: Diagram compilation logic
  - load_diagram.py: Loading from various sources
  - serialize_diagram.py: Format conversion
  - validate_diagram.py: Structure validation

### Registry (`registry/`)
- **service_registry.py**: Type-safe service locator
- **keys.py**: Service key definitions

### Utilities (`utils/`)
- **prompt_builder.py**: Dynamic prompt construction

## Service Registry
```python
# Type-safe service registration
LLM_SERVICE = ServiceKey["LLMServicePort"]("llm_service")
registry.register(LLM_SERVICE, llm_service_instance)
llm_service = registry.resolve(LLM_SERVICE)  # Type-safe
```

## Event Architecture

- **AsyncEventBus**: Fire-and-forget event distribution
- **CacheFirstStateStore**: Cache-first persistence with Phase 4 optimizations
- **Benefits**: No global locks, true parallel execution, clean separation

## Execution Flow
1. Compile diagram (uses CompileTimeResolver for connections)
2. Auto-register handlers
3. Initialize event bus
4. Execute loop:
   - Calculate ready nodes (DomainDynamicOrderCalculator)
   - Resolve inputs (domain.execution.resolution.api.resolve_inputs)
   - Execute handlers
   - Emit events (async persistence)
5. Handle errors via events

## Node Handlers

```python
@register_handler
class PersonJobNodeHandler(TypedNodeHandler[PersonJobNode]):
    async def execute_request(self, request: ExecutionRequest) -> Envelope:
        # Use orchestrator for person management
        person = await self.orchestrator.get_or_create_person(person_id)
        
        # Return output using EnvelopeFactory
        return EnvelopeFactory.create(
            body=result_data,
            produced_by=str(node.id),
            trace_id=request.execution_id
        )
```

- Auto-discovered via `@register_handler` decorator
- Receive: node instance, context, inputs, services
- Return Envelope objects using EnvelopeFactory
- Support single-file or package structure
- Use ExecutionOrchestrator for person/memory/prompt management

### Output Handling

All handlers use the **Envelope pattern**:

```python
# Text output
EnvelopeFactory.create(content, produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)

# JSON/object output  
EnvelopeFactory.create(data, produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)

# Binary output
EnvelopeFactory.create(bytes_data, produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)

# Error output
EnvelopeFactory.create(msg, error="Error", produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)

# With multiple representations
envelope = EnvelopeFactory.create(data, produced_by=node_id, trace_id=trace_id)
envelope = envelope.with_representations({
    "text": str(data),
    "object": data,
    "markdown": format_as_markdown(data)
})
```

Benefits:
- **Type safety**: Content-type aware transformations
- **Multiple representations**: Same data in different formats
- **Clean API**: Consistent interface across all handlers
- **Traceability**: Built-in trace_id and produced_by metadata

## Design Principles
1. **Separation of Concerns**: Domain (logic) ‚Üê‚Üí Application (orchestration) ‚Üê‚Üí Infrastructure (I/O)
2. **Dependency Injection**: Via ServiceRegistry
3. **Type Safety**: Compile-time guarantees
4. **Event-Driven**: Async, decoupled communication
5. **Extensibility**: Add handlers for new node types
6. **Single Source of Truth**: ExecutionOrchestrator for execution-time concerns
7. **Context-First**: Access execution context directly (e.g., `context.diagram`)


## Integration Points

**Domain Layer**:
- `dipeo.domain.diagram.compilation` - Compile-time resolution
- `dipeo.domain.execution.resolution` - Runtime input resolution
- `dipeo.domain.events` - Event contracts
- `dipeo.domain.ports.storage` - Storage interfaces

**Infrastructure Layer**:
- AsyncEventBus, CacheFirstStateStore, MessageRouter

**Server Layer**:
- GraphQL/REST adapters, event bus initialization

## Key Imports

```python
from dipeo.domain.execution.resolution import RuntimeInputResolver, TransformationEngine
from dipeo.domain.execution.envelope import EnvelopeFactory
from dipeo.domain.diagram.compilation import CompileTimeResolver, Connection
from dipeo.domain.events import EventType, ExecutionEvent
from dipeo.domain.ports.storage import FileSystemPort
from dipeo.domain.integrations.api_services import APIBusinessLogic
from dipeo.application.execution.orchestrators import ExecutionOrchestrator
from dipeo.application.execution.use_cases import PromptLoadingUseCase
```

## Diagram Access Patterns

### ‚úÖ DO: Use diagram query methods
Always use ExecutableDiagram's built-in query methods for accessing diagram data:

```python
# Get a specific node
node = context.diagram.get_node(node_id)

# Get nodes by type
person_job_nodes = context.diagram.get_nodes_by_type(NodeType.PERSON_JOB)

# Get incoming edges for a node
incoming = context.diagram.get_incoming_edges(node_id)

# Get outgoing edges for a node
outgoing = context.diagram.get_outgoing_edges(node_id)

# Get start nodes
start_nodes = context.diagram.get_start_nodes()
```

### ‚ùå DON'T: Direct access to internals
Never directly access diagram internal collections:

```python
# BAD: Direct access to nodes
for node in diagram.nodes:  # ‚ùå Don't do this
    if node.type == NodeType.PERSON_JOB:
        ...

# GOOD: Use query method
for node in diagram.get_nodes_by_type(NodeType.PERSON_JOB):  # ‚úÖ Do this
    ...

# BAD: Direct access to edges
incoming = [e for e in diagram.edges if e.target_node_id == node_id]  # ‚ùå

# GOOD: Use query method
incoming = diagram.get_incoming_edges(node_id)  # ‚úÖ
```

### Why This Matters
- **Performance**: Query methods use pre-indexed lookups (O(1) instead of O(n))
- **Maintainability**: Internal structure can change without breaking code
- **Type Safety**: Query methods provide consistent interfaces
- **Testing**: Easier to mock query methods than complex diagram structures

### Enforcement
A pre-commit hook (`check-diagram-access.py`) enforces these patterns in the application layer.

    82‚Üí  - **Anthropic** (`UnifiedAnthropicClient`): Claude models with tool use support

    85‚Üí  - **Claude Code** (`UnifiedClaudeCodeClient`): Claude Code SDK integration with session pooling
    86‚Üí- **Capabilities**: 
    87‚Üí  - Retry logic with exponential backoff
    88‚Üí  - Streaming support (SSE mode)
    89‚Üí  - Structured output (JSON schema and Pydantic)
    90‚Üí  - Tool/function calling
    91‚Üí  - Phase-aware execution
    92‚Üí  - Batch processing support (provider-specific)
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí### Messaging (v1.0 Unified)
    95‚Üí- **MessageRouter**: Central event distribution
    96‚Üí- **Flow**: Engine ‚Üí EventBus ‚Üí MessageRouter ‚Üí GraphQL/SSE
    97‚Üí- **Unified EventBus**: Single protocol replacing DomainEventBus, EventEmitter, EventConsumer, MessageBus
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí### Code Generation
   100‚Üí- **parsers/**: TypeScript AST parsing
   101‚Üí- **templates/**: Jinja2 with custom filters
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí## Environment Variables
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí```bash
   106‚ÜíDIPEO_BASE_DIR=/path/to/project    # Project root
   107‚ÜíDIPEO_PORT=8000                    # Server port  
   108‚ÜíDIPEO_DEFAULT_LLM_MODEL=gpt-5-nano-2025-08-07  # Default LLM
   109‚ÜíDIPEO_LLM_TIMEOUT=300               # LLM timeout (seconds)
   110‚ÜíDIPEO_EXECUTION_TIMEOUT=3600       # Max execution time
   111‚ÜíDIPEO_PARALLEL_EXECUTION=true      # Enable parallel
   112‚Üí```
   113‚Üí
   114‚Üí## Component Lifecycle (v1.0 Mixin-based)
   115‚Üí
   116‚Üí```python
   117‚Üí# 1. Create via DI container with mixin composition
   118‚Üíservice = DiagramService(storage, converter)  # Inherits LoggingMixin, ValidationMixin
   119‚Üí# 2. Initialize (mixin methods available)
   120‚Üíawait service.initialize()
   121‚Üí# 3. Use with mixin capabilities
   122‚Üídiagram = await service.load_from_file("diagram.json")  # Auto-logging, validation
   123‚Üí# 4. Cleanup
   124‚Üíawait service.cleanup()

   135‚Üí
   136‚Üí## Best Practices
   137‚Üí
   138‚Üí1. **Use Ports**: Import from `dipeo.domain.ports`, not concrete adapters
   139‚Üí2. **Handle Retries**: Implement exponential backoff in adapters
   140‚Üí3. **Async I/O**: All I/O operations should be async
   141‚Üí4. **Centralize Config**: Use `get_settings()` for all configuration
   142‚Üí5. **Log Operations**: Debug-level for normal ops, error for failures
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí## Adding New Infrastructure
   145‚Üí
   146‚Üí### Storage Adapter
   147‚Üí1. Implement port: `class RedisAdapter(BlobStorePort)`
   148‚Üí2. Register in DI container
   149‚Üí3. Wire to services
   150‚Üí
   151‚Üí### LLM-based Adapter
   152‚Üí1. Create adapter in `llm/adapters/`: `class CustomLLMAdapter`
   153‚Üí2. Use orchestrator for person/facet management
   154‚Üí3. Wire to appropriate handlers or evaluators
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí### Conversation Repository
   157‚Üí1. Implement repository interface
   158‚Üí2. Create adapter: `class RedisConversationRepository`
   159‚Üí3. Register in DI container
   160‚Üí
   161‚Üí### LLM Provider  
   162‚Üí1. Create unified client: `class UnifiedMistralClient` in `providers/mistral/unified_client.py`
   163‚Üí2. Implement required methods: `async_chat()`, `stream()`, `batch_chat()`
   164‚Üí3. Update factory in `llm/drivers/factory.py` to return the unified client
   165‚Üí4. Export from `providers/mistral/__init__.py`
   166‚Üí
   167‚Üí#### OpenAI API Migration Notes (2025)
   168‚Üí- The OpenAI SDK migrated from `chat.completions.create()` to `responses.create()`
   169‚Üí- Key changes:
   170‚Üí  - `messages` ‚Üí `input`
   171‚Üí  - `max_tokens` ‚Üí `max_output_tokens`
   172‚Üí  - Temperature parameter removed
   173‚Üí  - Structured output: `parse()` for Pydantic, `create()` for JSON schema
   174‚Üí- Response structure: `response.output[0].content[0].text`
   175‚Üí- TokenUsage compatibility: Added `total` property mapping to `total_tokens`
   176‚Üí
   177‚Üí### External API
   178‚Üí1. Create provider: `class JiraProvider(BaseProvider)`
   179‚Üí2. Register in integrated API service
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí## Common Issues
   182‚Üí
   183‚Üí| Issue | Solution |
   184‚Üí|-------|----------|
   185‚Üí| Adapter not initialized | Ensure `await service.initialize()` called |
   186‚Üí| Connection timeout | Increase `DIPEO_API_TIMEOUT` |
   187‚Üí| File not found | Check `DIPEO_BASE_DIR` and paths |
   188‚Üí| Rate limit exceeded | Adjust `DIPEO_LLM_MAX_RETRIES` |
   189‚Üí| OpenAI temperature error | Temperature not supported in new `responses` API |
   190‚Üí| OpenAI parameter error | Use `max_output_tokens` not `max_tokens` |
   191‚Üí| TokenUsage missing 'total' | Use `total_tokens` or compatibility property |
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí## v1.1 Architecture Changes (2025-09-10)
   194‚Üí
   195‚Üí### LLM Provider Simplification (Phase 3B)
   196‚Üí- **Unified Clients**: All providers now use single unified client per provider
   197‚Üí- **Removed Layers**: Eliminated adapter.py, client.py, adapter_wrapper.py files
   198‚Üí- **Direct Factory Returns**: Factory returns unified clients directly, no adapter wrapping
   199‚Üí- **Benefits**:
   200‚Üí  - 50% less code in provider directories
   201‚Üí  - Single source of truth per provider
   202‚Üí  - Easier to add new providers
   203‚Üí  - Clearer separation between domain logic and provider logic
   204‚Üí
   205‚Üí## v1.0 Architecture Changes (2025-09-05)
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí### Service Architecture
   208‚Üí- **BaseService Removal**: Services now use optional mixin composition instead of base class inheritance
   209‚Üí- **Available Mixins**: LoggingMixin, ValidationMixin, ConfigurationMixin, CachingMixin, InitializationMixin
   210‚Üí- **Flexible Composition**: Services implement only needed capabilities
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí### Event System
   213‚Üí- **Unified EventBus**: Single protocol replacing DomainEventBus, EventEmitter, EventConsumer, MessageBus
   214‚Üí- **Simplified Flow**: Engine ‚Üí EventBus ‚Üí MessageRouter ‚Üí GraphQL/SSE
   215‚Üí- **No Adapter Layer**: CacheFirstStateStore implements StateRepository protocol directly
   216‚Üí
   217‚Üí### Repository Simplification
   218‚Üí- **StateRepositoryAdapter Removed**: CacheFirstStateStore now implements protocol directly
   219‚Üí- **Cleaner Architecture**: Fewer abstraction layers, direct protocol implementation
   220‚Üí
   221‚Üí## Performance & Security
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí### Performance
   224‚Üí- **Connection Pooling**: LLM adapters cache for 1 hour
   225‚Üí- **Async I/O**: Use `asyncio.gather()` for parallel ops
   226‚Üí- **Bounded Queues**: SSE uses `Queue(maxsize=100)` for backpressure
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí### Security
   229‚Üí- Never log API keys
   230‚Üí- Validate file paths and extensions
   231‚Üí- Set timeouts and size limits
   232‚Üí

# Infrastructure Layer

Concrete implementations of domain ports for all I/O operations.

## Structure

| Module | Purpose |
|--------|----------|
| `codegen/` | TypeScript AST parsing, Jinja2 templates |
| `diagram/` | Diagram compilation, storage, conversion |
| `events/` | Event bus (in-memory, Redis) |
| `execution/` | State management, message routing |
| `integrations/` | External APIs (Notion, Slack) |
| `llm/` | LLM providers (unified clients), domain adapters, simplified service |
| `repositories/` | Conversation storage (in-memory, persistent) |
| `shared/` | File system, database, API keys |

## Key Patterns

```python
# Port/Adapter - Domain defines interface, infra implements
class LocalBlobAdapter(BlobStorePort):
    async def put(self, key: str, data: bytes) -> str:
        pass

# Driver - Orchestrates multiple adapters with mixin composition
class DiagramService(LoggingMixin, ValidationMixin, DiagramPort):
    def __init__(self, storage: DiagramStoragePort, converter: DiagramConverterService):
        pass

# Configuration - Centralized settings
from dipeo.infrastructure.config import get_settings
settings = get_settings()  # Uses DIPEO_* env vars

# Dependency Injection - Wired through containers
filesystem = request.services.get("filesystem_adapter")
```

## Components

### Storage Adapters
| Adapter | Use Case |
|---------|----------|
| `LocalFileSystemAdapter` | Config files, temp files |
| `LocalBlobAdapter` | Versioned storage |
| `S3Adapter` | Cloud deployments |
| `ArtifactStoreAdapter` | ML models, binaries |

### LLM Adapters (`llm/adapters/`)
- **LLMMemorySelectionAdapter**: Implements MemorySelectionPort using LLM
  - Creates selector facets for intelligent memory selection
  - Filters out selector facet messages from candidates
  - Preserves system messages automatically
  - Supports natural language criteria for selection
  - Features: Message deduplication, scoring, ranking
- **LLMDecisionAdapter**: Binary decision making using LLM
  - Creates decision facets for unbiased evaluation
  - Parses YES/NO responses with keyword detection
  - Supports memory profiles for context control
  - Used by condition nodes for AI-powered flow control

### Conversation Repositories
- **InMemoryConversationRepository**: Fast, ephemeral storage
- **InMemoryPersonRepository**: Person entity management
- **Features**: Message filtering, person-specific views

### LLM Infrastructure (Updated 2025-09-10)
- **LLMInfraService**: Main LLM orchestrator
- **Unified Client Architecture**: 
  - Core types in `llm/core/types.py` (AdapterConfig, TokenUsage, LLMResponse)
  - All providers use unified clients directly (no adapter/client separation)
  - Each provider has a single `unified_client.py` file
- **Domain Adapters** (`llm/domain_adapters/`):
  - `memory_selection.py`: LLMMemorySelectionAdapter for intelligent memory filtering
  - `decision.py`: LLMDecisionAdapter for binary decision making
- **Provider Unified Clients** (`llm/providers/`): 
  - **OpenAI** (`UnifiedOpenAIClient`): Uses new `responses.create()` and `responses.parse()` APIs
    - `input` parameter instead of `messages`
    - `max_output_tokens` instead of `max_tokens`
    - `text_format` for structured output with Pydantic models
    - Temperature not supported in new API
  - **Anthropic** (`UnifiedAnthropicClient`): Claude models with tool use support
  - **Google** (`UnifiedGoogleClient`): Gemini models
  - **Ollama** (`UnifiedOllamaClient`): Local model support with auto-pull
  - **Claude Code** (`UnifiedClaudeCodeClient`): Claude Code SDK integration with session pooling
- **Capabilities**: 
  - Retry logic with exponential backoff
  - Streaming support (SSE mode)
  - Structured output (JSON schema and Pydantic)
  - Tool/function calling
  - Phase-aware execution
  - Batch processing support (provider-specific)

### Messaging (v1.0 Unified)
- **MessageRouter**: Central event distribution
- **Flow**: Engine ‚Üí EventBus ‚Üí MessageRouter ‚Üí GraphQL/SSE
- **Unified EventBus**: Single protocol replacing DomainEventBus, EventEmitter, EventConsumer, MessageBus

### Code Generation
- **parsers/**: TypeScript AST parsing
- **templates/**: Jinja2 with custom filters

## Environment Variables

```bash
DIPEO_BASE_DIR=/path/to/project    # Project root
DIPEO_PORT=8000                    # Server port  
DIPEO_DEFAULT_LLM_MODEL=gpt-5-nano-2025-08-07  # Default LLM
DIPEO_LLM_TIMEOUT=300               # LLM timeout (seconds)
DIPEO_EXECUTION_TIMEOUT=3600       # Max execution time
DIPEO_PARALLEL_EXECUTION=true      # Enable parallel
```

## Component Lifecycle (v1.0 Mixin-based)

```python
# 1. Create via DI container with mixin composition
service = DiagramService(storage, converter)  # Inherits LoggingMixin, ValidationMixin
# 2. Initialize (mixin methods available)
await service.initialize()
# 3. Use with mixin capabilities
diagram = await service.load_from_file("diagram.json")  # Auto-logging, validation
# 4. Cleanup
await service.cleanup()
```

## Error Handling

```python
try:
    result = await adapter.operation()
except Exception as e:
    raise StorageError(f"Operation failed: {e}")
```

## Best Practices

1. **Use Ports**: Import from `dipeo.domain.ports`, not concrete adapters
2. **Handle Retries**: Implement exponential backoff in adapters
3. **Async I/O**: All I/O operations should be async
4. **Centralize Config**: Use `get_settings()` for all configuration
5. **Log Operations**: Debug-level for normal ops, error for failures

## Adding New Infrastructure

### Storage Adapter
1. Implement port: `class RedisAdapter(BlobStorePort)`
2. Register in DI container
3. Wire to services

### LLM-based Adapter
1. Create adapter in `llm/adapters/`: `class CustomLLMAdapter`
2. Use orchestrator for person/facet management
3. Wire to appropriate handlers or evaluators

### Conversation Repository
1. Implement repository interface
2. Create adapter: `class RedisConversationRepository`
3. Register in DI container

### LLM Provider  
1. Create unified client: `class UnifiedMistralClient` in `providers/mistral/unified_client.py`
2. Implement required methods: `async_chat()`, `stream()`, `batch_chat()`
3. Update factory in `llm/drivers/factory.py` to return the unified client
4. Export from `providers/mistral/__init__.py`

#### OpenAI API Migration Notes (2025)
- The OpenAI SDK migrated from `chat.completions.create()` to `responses.create()`
- Key changes:
  - `messages` ‚Üí `input`
  - `max_tokens` ‚Üí `max_output_tokens`
  - Temperature parameter removed
  - Structured output: `parse()` for Pydantic, `create()` for JSON schema
- Response structure: `response.output[0].content[0].text`
- TokenUsage compatibility: Added `total` property mapping to `total_tokens`

### External API
1. Create provider: `class JiraProvider(BaseProvider)`
2. Register in integrated API service

## Common Issues

| Issue | Solution |
|-------|----------|
| Adapter not initialized | Ensure `await service.initialize()` called |
| Connection timeout | Increase `DIPEO_API_TIMEOUT` |
| File not found | Check `DIPEO_BASE_DIR` and paths |
| Rate limit exceeded | Adjust `DIPEO_LLM_MAX_RETRIES` |
| OpenAI temperature error | Temperature not supported in new `responses` API |
| OpenAI parameter error | Use `max_output_tokens` not `max_tokens` |
| TokenUsage missing 'total' | Use `total_tokens` or compatibility property |

## v1.1 Architecture Changes (2025-09-10)

### LLM Provider Simplification (Phase 3B)
- **Unified Clients**: All providers now use single unified client per provider
- **Removed Layers**: Eliminated adapter.py, client.py, adapter_wrapper.py files
- **Direct Factory Returns**: Factory returns unified clients directly, no adapter wrapping
- **Benefits**:
  - 50% less code in provider directories
  - Single source of truth per provider
  - Easier to add new providers
  - Clearer separation between domain logic and provider logic

## v1.0 Architecture Changes (2025-09-05)

### Service Architecture
- **BaseService Removal**: Services now use optional mixin composition instead of base class inheritance
- **Available Mixins**: LoggingMixin, ValidationMixin, ConfigurationMixin, CachingMixin, InitializationMixin
- **Flexible Composition**: Services implement only needed capabilities

### Event System
- **Unified EventBus**: Single protocol replacing DomainEventBus, EventEmitter, EventConsumer, MessageBus
- **Simplified Flow**: Engine ‚Üí EventBus ‚Üí MessageRouter ‚Üí GraphQL/SSE
- **No Adapter Layer**: CacheFirstStateStore implements StateRepository protocol directly

### Repository Simplification
- **StateRepositoryAdapter Removed**: CacheFirstStateStore now implements protocol directly
- **Cleaner Architecture**: Fewer abstraction layers, direct protocol implementation

## Performance & Security

### Performance
- **Connection Pooling**: LLM adapters cache for 1 hour
- **Async I/O**: Use `asyncio.gather()` for parallel ops
- **Bounded Queues**: SSE uses `Queue(maxsize=100)` for backpressure

### Security
- Never log API keys
- Validate file paths and extensions
- Set timeouts and size limits
